intro: Krynitzkia hispidissima, commonly known as the woolly krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
